pageTitle: Pioneering the Internet: Dial‑up & Early ISPs (1992–2006)

timeline.title: Pakistan's First Dial‑Up Email Service
timeline.summary: Imran‑Net in Lahore introduces Pakistan's first dial‑up email service, followed shortly by UNDP's Sustainable Development Networking Programme (SDNPK) in Islamabad, Karachi, and Lahore for dial‑up email and UUCP services

timeline.title: First Academic Email
timeline.summary: National universities (via HEJ Research Institute, Karachi University) get the first email node and access to USENET news groups

timeline.title: First Commercial Dial‑Up Internet
timeline.summary: Digicom Pakistan launches the first commercial dial‑up Internet service (128 kbps link) in Karachi; engineer Nasser Khan Ghazi is credited with installing Pakistan's inaugural internet link

timeline.title: Privatization Begins
timeline.summary: PTA is formed; Paknet (PTCL subsidiary) and COMSATS begin dial‑up & low‑speed graphical access (14.4–28.8 kbps) in Karachi, Lahore & Islamabad; .pk domain introduced; private ISP sector opens

timeline.title: Speed Upgrade & Cybernet
timeline.summary: Dial‑up speeds rise to 33.6 kbps; cyber‑cafés spread. By 1997, speeds hit 56 kbps, and Cybernet (later Cyber Internet Services) launches in Karachi (1997)
